intro: Monardella mojavensis, commonly known as Mojave lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand drought and extreme temperatures. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers, which range in color from white to pale yellow, attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
